qas.question: What did Kerry do on Apr 22, 1971?

answers.text: appeared before a U.S. Senate committee hearing

qas.question: What was the topic of the hearing Kerry testified on?
What did Kerry throw over a fence?

answers.text: some of his own decorations and awards as well as some given to him by other veterans to throw

qas.question: Why did Kerry participate in the protest?

answers.text: for peace and justice, and to try and make this country wake up once and for all

qas.question: How many vets participated in the protest?

context: On April 22, 1971, Kerry <a0_0>appeared before a U.S. Senate committee hearing<a0_0/> on proposals relating to <a1_0>ending the war<a1_0/>. The day after this testimony, Kerry participated in a demonstration with thousands of other veterans in which he and other Vietnam War veterans threw their medals and service ribbons over a fence erected at the front steps of the United States Capitol building to dramatize their opposition to the war. Jack Smith, a Marine, read a statement explaining why the veterans were returning their military awards to the government. For more than two hours, <a4_0>almost 1000<a4_0/> angry veterans tossed their medals, ribbons, hats, jackets, and military papers over the fence. Each veteran gave his or her name, hometown, branch of service and a statement. Kerry threw <a2_0>some of his own decorations and awards as well as some given to him by other veterans to throw<a2_0/>. As Kerry threw his decorations over the fence, his statement was: "I'm not doing this for any violent reasons, but <a3_0>for peace and justice, and to try and make this country wake up once and for all<a3_0/>."
